issue.title: [CF 932] Icon Toggle through Keybind
issue.body:
Hi, been a while.

I was wondering if there was any way (existing or easily implementable) to enable/disable an icon via a keybind during combat. I could get the functionality that I want with another metaicon, but it'd be about 95% the same as an already existing metaicon. It would be much more convenient to just dynamically enable/disable the one icon that sets them apart.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #932 | Raw

comments.body:
Make a macro (this is for 7.0.0, hence the profile/global in the command. Omit the profile/global in the command for v6.2.6, but i'm pretty sure that you're using 7.0.0, haha):

/tmw [enable||disable||toggle] [profile||global] groupID iconID

For example:

/tmw enable profile 3 11 /tmw disable global 4 2

Edited Mar 18, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Also, welcome back!


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

There is still some buggy behavior with this feature. As far as I can tell if you exit config mode with an icon disabled, you can't use the toggle macro to enable it.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Ok, I'll look into it when I get back next week.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Unable to reproduce that issue. It is working fine for me on a disabled icon, both when coming from a fresh UI reload when the icon was disabled and when coming from config mode when the icon was just disabled (and also if it was disabled since login and not toggled before loading config mode).

Can you think of anything more specific about the circumstances that cause this to happen?

Edited Mar 28, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

My apologies, I should've noticed this from the outset. It's not the icon itself that isn't showing up. It's a metaicon that won't show the icon I'm toggling.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Ok, that makes sense. Fixed in 6.2.6-321-g2e0ecf6.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
